meanings.definition: A failure of a relationship or system.
meanings.sent1: After the big argument, there was a breakdown in their friendship.
meanings.sent2: The breakdown of the old bridge caused traffic delays.
meanings.sent3: It was a funny breakdown when the cat and dog refused to share the same bed.
meanings.sent4: The breakdown of communication between the two countries led to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent5: The breakdown of trust between them was irreversible.

meanings.definition: A sudden collapse in mental health.
meanings.sent1: She experienced a breakdown after the stressful exams.
meanings.sent2: His breakdown was a result of extreme anxiety.
meanings.sent3: The breakdown made him forget his own name momentarily.
meanings.sent4: The sudden breakdown left her feeling lost and confused.
meanings.sent5: The breakdown affected his ability to focus and concentrate.

meanings.definition: The process of analyzing or separating something into smaller parts.
meanings.sent1: During the science experiment, they had to do a breakdown of the chemical components.
meanings.sent2: The breakdown of the data helped them identify patterns in the information.
meanings.sent3: The breakdown of the cake ingredients made it easier to bake.
meanings.sent4: She did a breakdown of the novel to understand its themes better.
meanings.sent5: The breakdown of the problem into smaller steps made it more manageable.
